```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(srvyr)
library(janitor)
library(dplyr)
census <- read_csv("poverty1.csv")
census <- census [9:63 , 1:5] %>%
  na.omit() %>%
  rename(category = 1) %>%
  rename(total_pop = 2) %>%
  rename(in_poverty = 3) %>%
  rename(moe = 4) %>%
  rename(percent_poverty = 5)
view(census)
```

```{r, cleaning data}
race <- census [2:6, 1:5] %>%
  rename(race = category)
view(race)
age <- census [9:11, 1:5] %>%
  rename(age = category)
sex <- census [7:8, 1:5] %>%
  rename(sex = category)


```


## Data Visualization 1
# Race
```{r, visualization 1}
race %>%
  select(race, total_pop, in_poverty, percent_poverty) %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_col(mapping = aes(x = race, y = percent_poverty)) +
  labs(
    title = "Americans in Poverty in 2019 by Race",
    subtitle = "Data Visualization 01",
    caption = "Source: U.S. Census Bureau",
    x = "Race",
    y = "Percentage in Poverty"
  )
```
